captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

(SINGING) You are
the icing on my cake.

You are the smile
I can't replace.
You are, you are.
-Hey, braider nation.

I'm Amy from Cute Hair
Styles and today I'm

going to teach you how to
do the pull-through braid.

So it kind of looks like a
regular braid when you're done,

but I think it's really cool
and it definitely holds better.
So let's get started.

Now, we started by putting some
twists into the top of her head

just to add a little
bit of texture.

Now, that's definitely
not necessary.

You can just do a slicked-back
ponytail or one braid

or anything to jazz
it up if you want to.

But once you've had it in
a secure, high ponytail,

you're going to divide the
hair into two pieces, just
kind of like top and bottom.

Then you're going to take a
small elastic-- thank you,

she's going to be my
elastic helper today--

and you're going to
go down about 2 inches

and go ahead and wrap the
elastic around that hair,
just twice is fine.

It doesn't have
to be super tight.

Then what you're going to do
is divide the hair in half.

So you're going to make a
little hole in that section
that you just created.

You're going to reach
through and you're

going to pick up the back
section and pull it through.

And then you're just going
to go back, give the elastic

a little tug just to tighten
it up, and you're ready to go.

So now, again, you have
two pieces, top and bottom,

and you're going to
take another elastic

and go ahead and go
down about 2 inches, put
the elastic around the hair.

So you're just repeating the
same steps at this point.
Make a hole through the middle.

You can use a topsy tail if
you have one or your fingers,
either will work.

Reach down, grab
that bottom section.

It's easier the second
time because you've

got elastic in it and pull it
through, and then just tighten
up underneath.

And you're going to continue
to repeat this over and over.

So elastic, create a hole,
reach through, and then go

underneath, tighten it
up a little bit, elastic.
Thank you.
Caught some of that bottom hair.
Make a hole.
Pull it through.
Tighten it up.

So when you get to the end,
I pulled this last section

through and I'm just going to
hook them together this time

and put one more elastic
in the end of it.

Now, if you want, this is
kind of a skinny braid.

So I'm just going
to go back and just

pull on either side of them
and kind of flatten them
out, pancake them a little bit.

Just gonna give it
a wider, fuller look
like that I like better.

The best thing about
this particular braid

is that it holds really,
really well because you've

got so many elastics
mixed in there

it looks like a
regular braid sort of.

You can tell it's not because
it's missing that third strand

down the middle, but it
also holds a lot better.

Like she slept in
it with her hair,

and it looked like the same
hairstyle the next day.
It was crazy.
It looked great.

So there you go and
you're finished.

You can take a little bow or
something, whatever you'd like,

put it at the top for a little
funny accent, and you are done.
I love it.
Let's do the spin.
Very cute.

So I think this
hairstyle would even

be a great daddy do because
it's really pretty basic,

but it's definitely one that
all ages can do themselves.

Brooklyn did hers for the
first time this morning.

-And it was super easy and
fast, and it turned out great.

-I thought it was really
simple, very basic, so great one

for all ages and you guys
are really going to like it.

So last week, we
filmed a family video

where I showed off my
Minnie Mouse buttons,

but if you guys missed
the hair tutorial,
you can find it right here.

It's over on the
Disney Parks channel
so make sure to check out.

And next week-- super
exciting-- we have a "Hunger
Games"-related giveaway.
You guys are going to love it.

It's really crazy awesome,
so come back and see us then
and we will see you next week.
Bye guys.
See you.
-Bye.
-In the back.

Again, we're going to take
that second half of her hair,
twist it around our fingers.
Go ahead.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

(SINGING) You are, you are,
you are every bit of beautiful
-Hey, buddy, what are you doing?
-Jumping.
-What are you jumping on?
-A trampoline.

-Can you show us how
you can do a flip?

Scoot back and show me
how you can do a flip.
OK.
Right there.
-I can't stop.
-Do one.
Ooh, nice.
How about a cartwheel?
-A cartwheel with no hands.
-OK.
Do a cartwheel with no hands.

That was a nice
cartwheel with no hands.
That was just like your flip.
Good job, buddy.
